comments:
ARCH 302 is an introduction to two and three-dimensional design. Students explore the relationship between form and meaning, investigate the relationship between visual structure and metaphor, acquire creative problem-solving skills in abstract and concrete processes, develop a sense of material and craft, and learn to communicate verbally and graphically.

Students found this class enjoyable, in both pace and structure. They loved the main project and found this architecture class more useful and insightful than others they had taken previously.

Students complimented the professor, saying that he was an “excellent instructor, full of interesting insight and comments, and very passionate.” He did a good job of teaching the class, especially in managing the timeline of distributing projects vs. building models.

Students did not express frustration with the difficulty of the class, stating that expectations were high but not unreasonably so.
